intro: Mediolobivia steinmannii, commonly known as the Steinmann's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
